intro: Haloragis alata, commonly known as the slender willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and riverbanks. The plant has thin, willow-like stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Haloragis alata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
